body: Since mono_time is accessed from the main thread as well as the toxav thread it is needed to properly lock time updates. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1345)

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1345?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [3d21e66...ca370df](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1345?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
This is a clean extraction of some of the work of #1343

What problem is this solving?

According to the comment in mono_time.h, mono_time_update() is only 
meant to be called once per tox_iterate. So there shouldn't be any need 
for the mutex there, should there? Nor in mono_time_get().

There is what looks like a bug in the current code though: I don't see 
why at line 49 it's
`uint32_t add = ~0`
and not
`const uint64_t add = 0x100000000`
.

> What problem is this solving? According to the comment in mono_time.h, mono_time_update() is only meant to be called once per tox_iterate. So there shouldn't be any need for the mutex there, should there? Nor in mono_time_get(). 

The problem is that `mono_time_get()` is also called from the thread where `toxav_iterate()` is called and it's not protected against that.

> There is what looks like a bug in the current code though: I don't see why at line 49 it's `uint32_t add = ~0` and not `const uint64_t add = 0x100000000` .

The whole previous code was incorrect, because even in the comment it mentions multiple threads checking for overflow at the same time and then working around that problem with some hack. The correct way would either be some form of a mutex or atomic variables. I choose the read write lock, because writing is far more infrequent than reading the current time.

@zoff99 good catch, fixed them.

commit.message:
fix concurrency issues in mono_time

Since mono_time is accessed from the main thread as well as the toxav
thread it is needed to properly lock time updates.

Since mono_time is accessed from the main thread as well as the toxav
thread it is needed to properly lock time updates.

commit.message:
don't update the overflow state in current_time_monotonic

This could make mono_time loose overflows on Windows.

title: fix concurrency issues in mono_time
